div.style: border: 1px solid black; width: 100%; height: 300px; position: relative; -webkit-tap-highlight-color: rgba(255, 255, 255, 0);

canvas.style: position: absolute; top: 0px; left: 0px; z-index: 2; user-select: none; width: 716px; height: 281px;

div.canvas: This text is displayed if your browser does not support the Canvas HTML element.

div.style: position: absolute; overflow: auto; width: 716px; height: 298px; z-index: 1;

div.p: This sample shows the DOM (Document Object Model) of this webpage displayed as a tree. Each Node in the Diagram shows information about the corresponding HTML element in the DOM.

When a node is selected, the background color of the corresponding HTML Element changes to lightblue. Below the diagram are some more HTML elements to illustrate the effect. This sample also makes use of the TreeExpanderButton, which allows for parent nodes to expand and collapse their child nodes. Buttons are defined in Buttons.js.
Elements with an id attribute are noted in parenthesis.

div.style: display: inline-block; border: 1px solid gray; margin-left: 10px; width: 100px

div.p: For more uses of the TreeLayout see the DOM Tree and Visual Tree samples.

p.a: View this sample pages source in-page
